intro: Dombeya cuanzensis, commonly known as the Congo dombeya, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white, pink, or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
